get.description:
## Overview
Get daily sign-in records for the business's staff members within a specified date range.

Available for **Staff and Directory Tokens**.

parameters.description:
Required filter by date range using nested query parameter format. Both start_date and end_date are required. The results include both the start and end dates.

**Validation Rules:**
- Date range cannot exceed 31 days
- start_date must be before or equal to end_date

**Format:** `filter[start_date][eq]=YYYY-MM-DD&filter[end_date][eq]=YYYY-MM-DD`

**Example:** `filter[start_date][eq]=2026-01-01&filter[end_date][eq]=2026-01-15`
parameters.name: filter

sign_ins_by_date.description: Object with date strings as keys (format: YYYY-MM-DD) and arrays of staff UIDs as values. The keys are dynamic dates within the requested date range.

additionalProperties.description: Array of staff UIDs who signed in on this date

errors.message: start_date field must be a valid date parameter. Example, 2000-01-30

put.description:
## Overview
Updates a staff's properties. Available for **Directory tokens only**.

> **Note**: The `X-On-Behalf-Of` header is required to specify which business's staff member to update.

> **For Staff Self-Update**: Staff members who want to update their own details should use `PUT /v3/business_administration/staff_members/{uid}` with a Staff token instead.

parameters.description: Required. The business UID whose staff member is being updated. Can be the Business UID or nickname/external ID.
parameters.name: X-On-Behalf-Of

parameters.description: User id of the staff to be updated
parameters.name: uid

display_name.description: Staff display name. No longer than 255 characters, no HTML or new lines.

email.description: Staff email. Valid email format, unique email.

first_name.description: Staff first name. No longer than 255 characters, no HTML or new lines.

last_name.description: Staff last name. No longer than 255 characters, no HTML or new lines.

role.description: Please use the new Access Control API: https://developers.intandem.tech/v3.0/docs/main-concepts

sms_notifications_on.description: Staff SMS notifications on/off. A valid value [true/false].

post.description:
Create a new role for a business.

**Permission Hierarchy Validation:**
Permissions follow a hierarchy structure where category permissions (e.g., `payments.manage`) must be enabled before their extended permissions (e.g., `payments.invoices.export`) can be used. Extended permissions have three parts in their key (e.g., `category.subcategory.action`), while category permissions have two parts (e.g., `category.manage`). If you attempt to enable an extended permission without its corresponding category permission, the API will return a 400 error.

Available for **Staff Tokens**

code.description: A unique readable code for the role. Must be unique across all business roles. Common codes like 'admin', 'owner', 'staff', 'manager' typically already exist as default system roles. Use a unique code (e.g., 'custom_role_123') to avoid conflicts.

name.description: The role name as it's presented in the UI. By default, it will be assigned from the original permission, but can be overridden for a specific business

description.description: The role description as it’s presented in the UI. By default, it will be assigned from the original permission, but can be overridden for a specific business

permissions.description: A list of permissions that are assigned to the role by default

key.description: The unique identifier (key) of the Permission

allow.description: A flag indicating if this permission is by default assigned to the role

is_editable.description: A flag to indicate if the role can be edited by the business. By default, system roles are not editable. Can not be changed after creation

example.name: Billing Manager
example.description: Custom role for managing billing and payment operations

400.description: Bad Request - Permission hierarchy validation failed. Extended permissions require their category permission to be enabled.

message: Permission payments.invoices.export must have category payments.manage permission enabled

403.description: Forbidden - The staff role configuration feature is not enabled for this business. Contact your administrator to enable the roles_and_permissions feature.

errors.message: The staff role configuration feature is disabled

500.description: Internal Server Error - May occur when attempting to create a role with a code that already exists. Use GET /v3/access_control/business_roles to check existing codes before creating a new role.

get.description:
Get a list of Permissions.

**Note:** This endpoint returns an empty list if the `roles_and_permissions` feature is not enabled for the business. The presence of permissions in the response indicates that the business can use the Business Roles and Staff Permissions endpoints.

**Permission Types:**
- **Category permissions** (2 parts): e.g., `payments.manage` - Parent permissions that control access to a feature category
- **Extended permissions** (3 parts): e.g., `payments.invoices.export` - Child permissions that require their category permission to be enabled

Available for **Staff Tokens**

post.description:
## Overview
Create a new account under your directory. Most account details are cloned from an existing template to allow quick setup.

Available for **Directory tokens only**.

## Authentication
Uses HTTP Token authentication. Format: `Authorization: Token token="{DIRECTORY_TOKEN}"`

The token must be a Doorkeeper OAuth token with `directory` scope.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: HTTP Token authentication. Format: `Token token="{DIRECTORY_TOKEN}"`. The token must have `directory` scope.

admin_country_name.description: Admin country name. This is REQUIRED if the admin_phone parameter is sent

country_name.description: Business country. This is REQUIRED if the phone parameter is sent

template_business_id.description: ID of the template to create the account from

business_name.description: Account business/company name. e.g. 'The Tax Advisors'

package_name.description: For more details and available options please contact your account manager

setup.description: Suspend the account "to do" list (onboarding) If you want to edit the account settings before handing it to the account owner, send 'in_setup' to suspend the account "to do" list.  Send 'completed' if you do not want to suspend the account "to do" list

external_subscription_params.description: Billing params. Can send multiple parameter with a different key/value

external_id.description: You can use your own external ID to manage accounts

time_zone.description: Account time zone. e.g. Central Time (US & Canada)

member_tags.description: Tags per account. Will be displayed in the Partner Dashboard. Separate with a comma

Result.value: Bad parameter(s), see content for more information.

get.description:
## Overview
Update billing info and/or package to an existing account under your directory.

Available for **Directory tokens only**.

> **Deprecation Notice**: This is a legacy endpoint. For new integrations, please use the [Subscription endpoints](/docs/platform_administration/license) instead.

## Authentication
Uses HTTP Token authentication. Format: `Authorization: Token token="{DIRECTORY_TOKEN}"`

The token must be a Doorkeeper OAuth token with `directory` scope.

> **Note**: The `business_uid` parameter must correspond to a business that is a member of the directory associated with the directory token.

## Package Options
Use one of the following available packages: `platinum20`, `business20`.

Package names are managed in the database and may vary by directory. To obtain the complete list of available package names for your directory, please contact the support team.

parameters.name: package_name
parameters.description: The updated package you assign to the specific business, for more details and available options please contact your account manager

parameters.name: external_subscription_params
parameters.description: Billing params. Can send multiple parameter with a different key/value

parameters.name: edit_tags
parameters.description: Tags per account. Will be displayed in the Partner Dashboard. Separate with a comma

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: HTTP Token authentication. Format: `Token token="{DIRECTORY_TOKEN}"`. The token must have `directory` scope.

parameters.name: business_uid
parameters.description: The business UID (alphanumeric string like '88pzdbz1hmkdoel4'), not the numeric database ID. The business must be a member of the directory associated with the directory token.

parameters.name: add_sms_credits
parameters.description: The Number Of SMS Credit For Add To Account

parameters.name: delete_sms_credits
parameters.description: The Number Of SMS For Deletion From The Account

Result.value: Bad parameter(s), see content for more information.

post.description:
## Overview
Mark an account's setup/onboarding as completed. This suspends the account's "to do" list (onboarding wizard).

Available for **Directory tokens only**.

## Authentication
Uses HTTP Token authentication (not Bearer). Format: `Authorization: Token token="{DIRECTORY_TOKEN}"`

The token must be a Doorkeeper OAuth token with `directory` scope.

## How It Works
1. The endpoint looks up the business in the directory's members using `pivots.uid`
2. Calls `member.setup_completed!` to mark setup as done
3. Updates the member's `setup` attribute to `setup_completed`

> **Important**: The `business_uid` must be the business UID (alphanumeric like '88pzdbz1hmkdoel4'), NOT a numeric database ID. The business must be a member of the directory associated with the token.

parameters.name: business_uid
parameters.description: The business UID (alphanumeric string like '88pzdbz1hmkdoel4'). This maps to `pivots.uid` in the database. The business must be a member of the directory associated with the directory token.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: HTTP Token authentication. Format: `Token token="{DIRECTORY_TOKEN}"`. The token must have `directory` scope.

Result.value: Bad parameter(s), see content for more information.

post.description:
## Overview
Inject a lead into a business account under your directory.

Available for **Directory tokens only**.

## Authentication
Uses HTTP Token authentication. Format: `Authorization: Token token="{DIRECTORY_TOKEN}"`

The token must be a Doorkeeper OAuth token with `directory` scope.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: HTTP Token authentication. Format: `Token token="{DIRECTORY_TOKEN}"`. The token must have `directory` scope.

business_id.description: A unique identifier of the business. Can be the our business_uid or external_id

notifications.description: A list of notifications to send after processing of the lead. Possible values: "auto-reply" (thank you email to the end user), "email" (notify the business owner) or "sms" (text notification to the business owner). None if empty

identifier_type.description: Defines which unique identifier will be used to search for an existing lead or create a new one. Possible values: "email" or "unique_id"

email.description: Lead email address. Unique per lead

unique_id.description: Lead unique id. Unique per business

first_name.description: Lead first name. Mandatory for a new lead

opt_in.description: Send "true" if lead opted in for promotions. Make sure the "opt-in" client card field is added to the client card under Settings>Client card

request_title.description: Request title. Will also be the created conversation title

request_data.description: The information that the end user has provided. (e.g the labels and values of a contact form/client card).  Replace {field_name} with the field name/label. Repeat this parameter for every field. Value can be a string, if a date field value is given a string with the format YYYY-MM-DD is expected. Please note: this information is visible both to the business owner and to the end user. Therefore it should not contain private business information.

system_message.description: A message displayed to the business owner to introduce the lead. May contain links

source.description: Will be displayed to the business owner as the lead source

source_url.description: The URL of the page where the lead was created

Result.value: Bad parameter(s), see content for more information.

get.description:
## Overview
Create a one-time token for Single Sign On (SSO) login.

Available for **Directory tokens only**.

## Authentication
Uses HTTP Token authentication. Format: `Authorization: Token token="{DIRECTORY_TOKEN}"`

The token must be a Doorkeeper OAuth token with `directory` scope.

## SSO Process

**Step 1**: Call this endpoint to create a one-time SSO token.

**Step 2**: Build the SSO login URL using the token:
`https://api.vcita.com/v1/partners/sso/login?staff_uid={STAFF_UID}&sso_token={SSO_TOKEN}`

## Deep Links
To redirect users to a specific page after login, append the `redirect_to` query param:
`https://api.vcita.com/v1/partners/sso/login?staff_uid=xxxzzz111&sso_token={SSO_TOKEN}&redirect_to=/app/invoices/ru7q9qlt7cp4hfni`

## Impersonation
To create an impersonation session, include the `operator_uid` parameter. This adds the operator as the `actor_uid` with `actor_type` as `operator`.

> **Note**: The returned token is valid for 30 minutes. The `expires_at` value is in microseconds.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: HTTP Token authentication. Format: `Token token="{DIRECTORY_TOKEN}"`. The token must have `directory` scope.

parameters.name: staff_uid
parameters.description: The staff UID to create the SSO token for. Use this to log in users as specific staff members. If you want admin access, use the business owner's staff_uid.

parameters.name: operator_uid
parameters.description: Optional. The operator UID for impersonation sessions. When provided, the operator is set as the `actor_uid` with `actor_type` as `operator`, simulating an impersonation session.

sso_token.description: The one-time SSO token to use in the login URL.

expires_at.description: Token expiration timestamp in microseconds. The token is valid for 30 minutes from creation.

401.description: Unauthorized - Invalid or missing directory token.

Result.value: Bad parameter(s), see content for more information.

post.description:
## Overview
Creates a Business. By default, business creation is synchronous. To create a business asynchronously, set the 'synchronized' parameter to false in the 'meta' object. When set to false, the request returns immediately after input parameters validation and an async job is created to handle the business account creation.

## Uniqueness Constraint
The `admin_account.email` field must be unique across the entire platform. Attempting to create a business with an email that already exists will return a 400 error: 'admin_account.email already in use'.

**Testing Tip**: Use a dynamically generated email (e.g., with timestamp or UUID suffix) to avoid conflicts with existing accounts.

Available for **Directory and Internal tokens**.

200.description: Business Created. When 'synchronized' is true (default), the response includes the complete business data. When 'synchronized' is false, the response is returned immediately after validation and the business creation is processed asynchronously. In the asynchronous case, the final result will be delivered via webhook: success notifications are sent to subscribers of the 'business' entity with event_type 'create', and failure notifications are sent to subscribers of the 'account' entity with event_type 'rejected'.

business.description: Business data wrapper containing all business-related information

admin_account.description: Admin account details for the created business

staff_uid.description: Unique identifier for the staff member

created_at.description: Timestamp when the business was created

updated_at.description: Timestamp when the business was last updated

directory_id.description: Unique identifier of the directory the business belongs to

country_name.description: Country where the business is located

disable_analytics.description: Whether analytics are disabled for this business

dedicated_number.description: Dedicated phone number for the business

hide_address.description: Whether to hide the business address from clients

landing_page.description: Default landing page for the business

account_blocked_at.description: Timestamp when the account was blocked, if applicable

scheduling_disabled.description: Whether scheduling is disabled for this business

identities.description: List of identity identifiers associated with the business

in_setup.description: Whether the business is in setup mode

is_template.description: Whether this business is a template

invite.description: Reference ID to the marketing channel used for business acquisition

booking_settings.description: Settings related to booking and scheduling for the business

buffer_before.description: Buffer time in minutes before appointments

buffer_after.description: Buffer time in minutes after appointments

min_advance_booking.description: Minimum advance booking time in minutes

max_advance_booking.description: Maximum advance booking time in days

min_hours_before_meeting.description: Minimum hours required before a meeting can be scheduled

future_bookings_limit.description: Maximum number of days in the future that bookings can be made

branding.description: Branding configuration for the business including colors and visual settings

primary_color.description: Primary brand color in hex format

secondary_color.description: Secondary brand color in hex format

color.description: Main brand color in hex format

large_logo_url.description: URL to the large version of the business logo

xlarge_logo_url.description: URL to the extra-large version of the business logo

profile_picture_url.description: URL to the business profile picture

cover_picture_url.description: URL to the business cover picture

400.description:
Bad Request - Invalid parameters provided. Common causes include:
- **Email uniqueness constraint**: The email address in `admin_account.email` is already in use by another business account. Returns: 'admin_account.email already in use'
- **Missing required fields**: The `admin_account.email` field is required. Returns: 'admin_account.email is required'
- **Invalid email format**: The email address doesn't match standard email format. Returns: 'admin_account.email must be valid'
- **Validation errors**: Business name contains restricted terms, fields exceed length limits, or invalid values provided.

message.description: Human-readable error message describing the issue

data.description: Array of specific validation error messages

401.description: Unauthorized - Invalid or missing authentication token.

409.description: Conflict - A business with the provided email or external_reference_id already exists.

500.description: Internal Server Error - An unexpected error occurred while processing the request.

country_name.description: Business’s Country. Must be a valid country name

display_name.description: Owner’s display name. Up to 255 characters, no HTML tags, no new lines (if not provided, FIRST NAME + LAST NAME will be used)

email.description: Owner's email, also used as the business's main email. Must be unique across the platform - attempting to create a business with an email that already exists will return a 400 error.

first_name.description: Owner’s first name. Up to 255 characters, no HTML tags, no new lines

language.description: One of en,es,fr,it,pt,de,pl,nl,en-GB. Default determined by Directory

last_name.description: Owner’s last name. Up to 255 characters, no HTML tags, no new lines

phone.description: Business phone number. Up to 20 characters

address.description: Business address. Up to 255 characters, no HTML tags

business_category.description: The business main occupation. Must be a valid business category

hide_address.description: Whether to show the business address to clients

landing_page.description: Deprecated - Previously used for marketing purposes, up to 255 characters

logo_url.description: Business logo URL - A valid image URL. Supporting formats: jpg, jpeg, gif, png, SVG. Make sure the URL includes one of these extensions. The URL will be validated by attempting to download the file to verify it exists.

post.description:
## Overview
This API performs entitlement verification for businesses seeking to register with a specific partner. It checks if a business exists in the partner's pre-loaded audience list and is eligible to be claimed.

## How It Works
Partners pre-load their eligible businesses into the `audiences` table (via CSV upload or Audiences API). Each audience record contains a `unique_validation_identifier` field that uniquely identifies the business (e.g., email address, tax ID, membership number).

This endpoint looks up the audience record by matching:
- `directory_uid` (from the Directory token)
- `unique_validation_identifier` (from the request body)
- `status` is not 'deleted'

## Use Case
Before creating a new business account under a partner directory, call this endpoint to verify the business is in the partner's approved audience list.

Available for **Directory tokens only**.

200.description: Audience record found. Returns the audience record from the partner's audience table, confirming the business is eligible for partnership enrollment.

data.description: The audience record from the audiences table

unique_external_identifier.description: Partner's reference ID for this business

unique_validation_identifier.description: The validation identifier used for claim verification

status.description: Current status of the audience record

business_uid.description: vcita business UID (populated after the audience is claimed)

400.description: Bad Request - No audience record found matching the provided unique_validation_identifier in the partner's directory. The business is not in the partner's approved audience list.

401.description: Unauthorized - Only Directory tokens are accepted for this endpoint. Staff, App, and Admin tokens will be rejected.

unique_validation_identifier.description: The unique identifier used to look up the business in the partner's audience table. This value must exactly match the `unique_validation_identifier` field of an existing audience record for the partner's directory. Common values include: email address (e.g., 'john@doe.com'), tax ID, membership number, or any partner-specific identifier. The value is provided by the partner when they upload their audience list.

post.description:
## Overview
Revoke a specific access token by providing the token value. The token must be accessible by the authenticated caller (e.g., a Directory token can only revoke tokens it issued).

Available for **Staff, Application, and Directory tokens**.

## Authorization Rules
- **Staff tokens**: Can revoke tokens associated with the authenticated user.
- **Directory tokens**: Can revoke tokens they issued to users or apps within their directory.
- **Application tokens**: Can revoke tokens they issued to users within their directory.

## Error Handling
- Returns 422 with `"error": "Unauthorized"` if the caller does not have permission to revoke the specified token.
- Returns 422 with `"error": "invalid token"` if the provided token value does not exist.

201.description: Token revoked successfully. Returns the list of tokens that were revoked.

401.description: Unauthorized - Invalid or missing authentication token in the request header.

422.description: Unprocessable Entity - The request was valid but could not be processed. This occurs when the caller does not have permission to revoke the specified token, or when the provided token value does not exist.

500.description: Internal Server Error - An unexpected error occurred while processing the request.

token.description: The access token value to revoke. This is the actual token string (e.g., "abc123xyz"), not a token identifier or UID.

post.description:
## Overview
Subscribe to webhook notifications. Webhooks allow you to receive real-time notifications when specific events occur in the system. You must specify the event (a combined string of entity and event_type in the format 'entity/event_type') and the target_url where notifications will be sent.

Available for **Staff and Directory Tokens**.

## Event Format
The `event` parameter uses the format `entity/event_type` where:
- **entity**: The object type to monitor (e.g., 'client', 'business', 'meeting', 'payment')
- **event_type**: The action that triggers the notification (e.g., 'created', 'updated', 'deleted')

## Common Events
- `client/created` - New client created
- `business/created` - New business created
- `meeting/created` - New meeting scheduled
- `meeting/cancelled` - Meeting cancelled
- `payment/paid` - Payment received
- `invoice/issued` - Invoice issued

## Error Responses
Returns HTTP 500 with `{"response": "Not Subscribed"}` when subscription fails (e.g., invalid event format, service unavailable).

201.description: Webhook subscription created successfully. Returns a subscription_id that can be used to identify this subscription.

400.description: Bad Request - Invalid parameters provided. The event format may be invalid (must be 'entity/event_type'), the target_url format is incorrect, or required fields are missing.

401.description: Unauthorized - Invalid or missing authentication token.

500.description: Subscription Failed - The webhook subscription could not be created. This typically occurs when the event format is invalid, the target URL is unreachable, or the webhook service encounters an error. Note: This status code is also returned for business-rule failures that should ideally be 400 errors.

event.description: The event to subscribe to in the format 'entity/event_type'. The entity is the object type to monitor (e.g., 'client', 'business', 'meeting') and event_type is the action that triggers the webhook (e.g., 'created', 'updated', 'deleted', 'cancelled').

event_type.description: The type of event that triggers the webhook notification. This specifies what action or state change should trigger the webhook. Common event types include: 'create' (object created), 'update' (object updated), 'delete' (object deleted), 'scheduled' (appointment/event scheduled), 'cancelled' (appointment/event cancelled), 'rejected' (request rejected, e.g., business creation failure), 'paid' (payment received), 'recorded' (payment recorded), 'issued' (invoice/estimate issued), 'sent' (message sent), and 25 other event types. See the enum list below for all available event types.

post.description:

Available for **Staff and Directory Tokens**.

event.description: Object / Event name to unsubscribe from (optional). If not provided, all subscriptions for the target_url will be removed.

target_url.description: The webhook URL that was used when subscribing. Must match exactly the URL used during subscription.

Filtering the list of webhooks.
Filter is a 'deepObject' works with:
  1. 'entity' - object which listen to event (example: client)
  2. 'event_type' - type of event to trigger webhook (example: created)

Example:
  <url>?filter[entity]=client&filter[event_type]=created
parameters.name: filter

success.description: Indicates the success status of the request (e.g., "ok").

id.description: The unique identifier of the webhook subscription.

entity.description: Object / Event name that the webhook is subscribed to. This is the entity type being monitored. Available entities include: 'business' (business accounts), 'client' (client records), 'appointment' (scheduled appointments), 'payment' (payment transactions), 'invoice' (invoices), 'account' (account-related events), and 34 other entity types. See the enum list below for all available entities.

event_type.description: The type of event that triggers the webhook notification. This specifies what action or state change triggers the webhook. Common event types include: 'create' (object created), 'update' (object updated), 'delete' (object deleted), 'scheduled' (appointment/event scheduled), 'cancelled' (appointment/event cancelled), 'rejected' (request rejected), 'paid' (payment received), 'recorded' (payment recorded), 'issued' (invoice/estimate issued), 'sent' (message sent), and 25 other event types. See the enum list below for all available event types.

url.description: The target URL where webhook notifications will be sent.

## Overview
Creates a Staff Member.

Available for **Staff, Application, and Directory tokens**.

**Content-Type**: Requires `application/json` content type header.

parameters.name: business_uid

400.description:
Bad Request - Validation error. Common validation errors include:
- `staff parameters are missing` - The request body must contain a 'staff' object wrapper
- `staff.email is required` - Email is a mandatory field
- `staff.email must be valid` - Email format is invalid
- `staff.email already in use` - Email address is already associated with another user in the platform
- `staff.display_name is a mandatory field` - Display name is required
- `staff.role must be valid` - Role must be one of: admin, manager, marketing, collaborator, user
- `staff.first_name must not be longer than 256` - First name exceeds maximum length
- `staff.first_name must not contain html tags` - HTML tags are not allowed
- `staff.first_name must not contain newlines` - Newline characters are not allowed
- `meta.invite should be true/false` - Invite must be a boolean value

meta.description: Optional metadata for the staff creation request.

invite.description: Send invite to staff on creation. Defaults to false if not provided.

staff.description: **Required wrapper object** containing the staff member details. This top-level 'staff' key is mandatory - omitting it results in a 400 error.

display_name.description: Display name of the staff member. Must not be longer than 255 characters and must not contain HTML tags or newlines.

email.description: Email address of the staff member. Must be unique across the platform - attempting to create a staff member with an email that already exists will return an error.

first_name.description: First name of the staff member. Must not be longer than 255 characters and must not contain HTML tags or newlines.

last_name.description: Last name of the staff member. Must not be longer than 255 characters and must not contain HTML tags or newlines.

role.description: Role code assigned to the staff member within the business. Valid values are: admin, manager, marketing, collaborator, user. Defaults to 'user' if not provided. Note: These correspond to the `code` field from GET /v3/access_control/business_roles endpoint.

## Overview
Create a new Offering. Available for **Internal tokens only**.

## Prerequisites
Before creating an offering, obtain a valid SKU by calling `GET /v3/license/skus`. Use the `code_name` field from the response as the `SKU` value. The SKU type must match the offering type (e.g., use `GET /v3/license/skus?type=package` for package offerings).

**Note on External Payment Type:**
When creating an offering with `payment_type: external`, the `prices` array must be empty (`[]`). The system will automatically populate default prices with `-1.00` for all supported currencies, indicating that pricing is managed externally by the partner.

**Note on Free Payment Type:**
When creating an offering with `payment_type: free`, the `price` value in the `prices` array must be `0` or `-1`.

post.description:
## Overview
Create a new BundledOffering that links a parent offering with a child offering. When a customer purchases the parent offering, the bundled (child) offering is automatically included.

Available for **Internal tokens only**.

## Validation Rules

The following validation rules are enforced:

1. **Self-bundling not allowed**: The `offering_uid` and `bundled_offering_uid` must be different. An offering cannot be bundled to itself.

2. **Parent offering type restriction**: The parent offering (`offering_uid`) must be of type `package` or `app`. Other offering types cannot have bundled items.

3. **Child offering type restriction**: The bundled offering (`bundled_offering_uid`) cannot be of type `package`. Only `app` and `addon` offerings can be bundled.

4. **No duplicate bundles**: Each parent-child combination must be unique. Attempting to create a duplicate returns HTTP 409.

5. **Single staff slot per parent**: Only one `staff_slot` addon can be bundled to each parent offering.

6. **Directory consistency**: If the parent offering exists in a directory, the bundled offering must also exist in the same directory.

## Prerequisites

Before creating a bundled offering, obtain valid offering UIDs by calling `GET /v3/license/offerings`.

## Overview
Create a new Subscription for a business. Supports discounted and free plans using coupons.

Available for **Staff tokens**.

### Token Permissions

| Token Type | Allowed | Restrictions |
|------------|---------|-------------|
| **Staff** | Yes | Cannot set custom pricing. For `external` payment type offerings, must use a Staff token created by a Directory token. |
| **Directory** | No | Must create a Staff token first via `POST /platform/v1/tokens` |
| **Internal** | No | Must create a Staff token first |
| **Billing App** | Yes | Cannot set custom pricing |
| **Regular App** | No | Not allowed |

### Important: External Payment Type Offerings

Offerings with `payment_type = external` require a **Staff token created by a Directory token**:

1. Use `POST /platform/v1/tokens` with a Directory token to create a Staff token for the target business.
2. Use that Staff token to call this endpoint.

The `buyer_uid` in the subscription is automatically derived from the authenticated Staff token's identity.

post.summary: Exchange Authorization Code for Access Token
post.description:
## Overview
Exchanges an OAuth Authorization Code for an Access Token. This endpoint is the final step in the OAuth 2.0 Authorization Code flow.

**This endpoint does not require authentication headers** - authentication is performed via the `client_id` and `client_secret` in the request body.

## Prerequisites

Before using this endpoint, you must:

### 1. Create an OAuth Application
Create an app using `POST /platform/v1/apps` with a **Directory token**. This returns:
- `client_id`: Your OAuth Client ID
- `client_secret`: Your OAuth Client Secret (shown only once - store securely!)

Example app creation request:
```json
{
  "name": "My OAuth App",
  "app_code_name": "myoauthapp",
  "redirect_uri": "https://myapp.example.com/oauth/callback",
  "scopes": ["openid"]
}
```

### 2. Obtain an Authorization Code
Redirect users to the authorization endpoint to obtain consent:
```
GET /oauth/authorize?response_type=code&client_id={client_id}&redirect_uri={redirect_uri}&scope={scopes}&state={state}
```

After user authorization, they are redirected to your `redirect_uri` with:
- `code`: The authorization code (use this in the token request)
- `state`: The state parameter you provided (verify this matches)

### 3. Exchange Code for Token
Call this endpoint (`POST /oauth/token`) with the authorization code to receive an access token.

## Complete OAuth Flow Diagram

```
1. App Creation (one-time setup):
   POST /platform/v1/apps → Returns client_id, client_secret

2. User Authorization (browser redirect):
   User → /oauth/authorize → User grants permission → Redirect to app with code

3. Token Exchange (server-to-server):
   POST /oauth/token (with code) → Returns access_token

4. API Access:
   Use access_token in Authorization header for subsequent API calls
```

## Important Notes

- **Authorization codes are single-use** - once exchanged, they cannot be reused
- **Authorization codes expire quickly** - exchange them immediately after receiving
- **This endpoint cannot be tested in isolation** - it requires an authorization code from the user authorization flow
- **Store client_secret securely** - it is only displayed once during app creation

grant_type.description: The OAuth 2.0 grant type. Must be `authorization_code` for the Authorization Code flow.

client_id.description: The OAuth Client ID obtained when creating an app via `POST /platform/v1/apps`. This value is returned in the `data.client_id` field of the app creation response.

client_secret.description: The OAuth Client Secret obtained when creating an app via `POST /platform/v1/apps`. This value is returned in the `data.client_secret` field of the app creation response. **Important**: This secret is only shown once during app creation - store it securely.

code.description: The authorization code obtained from the OAuth authorization flow. This code is provided as a query parameter when the user is redirected back to your `redirect_uri` after authorizing your app. Authorization codes are single-use and expire shortly after being issued.

redirect_uri.description: The exact redirect URI that was used when initiating the authorization request. This must match one of the URIs configured for your app (either `redirect_uri` or one of the `oauth_redirect_uris` set during app creation).

code_verifier.description: **Optional - PKCE only**. The code verifier used when the authorization request was initiated with PKCE (Proof Key for Code Exchange). If your app used a `code_challenge` during authorization, you must provide the original `code_verifier` here. Note: PKCE support may vary - check server capabilities.

## Overview Get an account's activity report for the last 3 months, including the following information:
  1. Number of payments received
  2. Number of conversations started
  3. Number of bookings, including appointments booked and event attendance
  4. Number of campaigns created
  5. Number of documents shared by the business
  6. Total Number of clients
Note: Currently, the API has a rate limit of 1 request per 5 seconds. Results are cached for 24 hours. **Available for Staff Tokens**

bookings.description: Total number of bookings in the last 3 months

campaigns.description: Total number of campaigns in the last 3 months

conversations.description: Total number of conversations in the last 3 months

documents.description: Total number of documents in the last 3 months

payments.description: Total number of payments in the last 3 months

get.summary: Business account usage in the last 3 months

Bearer.description: Provide a valid bearer token in the Authorization header. Example: 'Authorization: Bearer {app_token}'

Directory.description: Provide a valid bearer token in the Authorization header. Example: 'Authorization: Bearer {app_token}'

field.description: The field that caused the error (if applicable).

type.description: Type of the offering. Possible values include: **package**: For the main business subscription; **app**: For marketplace app subscriptions; *addon**: for additional products like SMS, staff_seat and module.

SKU.description: The unique code of the single SKU this offering represents. Obtain valid SKU values by calling `GET /v3/license/skus` and using the `code_name` field from the response. The SKU type must match the offering type: use SKUs from `GET /v3/license/skus?type=package` for package offerings, `GET /v3/license/skus?type=addon` for addon offerings, and `GET /v3/license/skus?type=app` for app offerings. Offerings support exactly one SKU; to combine multiple SKUs, use a bundledOffering or similar higher-level abstraction.

quantity.description: The number of items included in the offering

payment_type.description:
The payment type field defines the payment options available for an offering. Possible values:
- **external**: Payment is managed outside the platform (typically via partner API). When using this type, the `prices` array must be empty (`[]`).
- **free**: No payment is required. When using this type, the `price` value in the `prices` array must be `0` or `-1`.
- **single_charge**: A single, one-time payment is required to obtain the offering.
- **monthly**: A recurring payment made on a monthly basis.
- **annual**: A recurring payment made on a yearly basis.
- **bundle**: A subscription bundled with another subscription. Bundled offerings cannot be sold separately.

is_active.description: Current status of the directory offering

vendor.description: The business entity or vendor that offers this SKU.

prices.description: Array of price objects for different currencies. **For `external` payment type**: Must be an empty array (`[]`). The system will automatically populate default prices with `-1.00` for all supported currencies, indicating that pricing is managed externally by the partner. **For `free` payment type**: The `price` value must be `0` or `-1`.

price.description: Cost of the offering. Must be >= 0 for paid payment types (`monthly`, `annual`, `single_charge`). Must be `0` or `-1` for `free` payment type.

currency.description: The currency used for the price. Supported currencies: USD, EUR, GBP, CHF.

trial.description: Number of days for the trial period. If not specified or set to 0, it indicates no trial period is offered.

reporting_tags.description: A list of tags to be used for reporting purposes. Tags categorize offerings for analytics and billing reports.

currency.description: The currency used for the price

trial.description: Number of days for the trial period. If not specified or set to 0, it indicates no trial period is offered.

is_active.description: Current status of the directory offering

reporting_tags.description: A list of tags to be used for reporting purposes. Tags categorize offerings for analytics and billing reports.

directory_offerings.description: List of newly created DirectoryOfferings (for bulk creation)

bundldedOfferings.description: List of newly created BundldedOfferings (for bulk creation)

directory_uid.description: Unique identifier for a directory. Defines which directory is authorized to sell this Offering.

offering_uid.description: Unique identifier for an Offering. Defines an offering the directory is authorized to sell.

CreateBundledOfferingDTO.description: Request body for creating a bundled offering relationship. A bundled offering links a parent offering (the main product being sold) with a child offering (included for free when the parent is purchased).

offering_uid.description: Unique identifier of the parent offering to which the bundled item is being added. This must be an existing Offering UID obtained from `GET /v3/license/offerings`. The parent offering must be of type `package` or `app` - other types are not allowed. This value must be different from `bundled_offering_uid` (an offering cannot be bundled to itself).

bundled_offering_uid.description: Unique identifier of the child offering to be bundled. This must be an existing Offering UID obtained from `GET /v3/license/offerings`. The child offering cannot be of type `package` - only `app` and `addon` types are allowed as bundled items. **Important**: This value must be different from `offering_uid` - an offering cannot be bundled to itself. Providing the same UID for both fields will result in a 400 error with message "Can't bundle an offering to itself".

CreateSubscriptionDTO.description: Request body for creating a new subscription. The `buyer_uid` is automatically determined from the authenticated token - it cannot be specified in the request body. For Staff tokens, this is the staff member's UID. Note: Only Directory or Internal tokens are allowed to set a custom price override.

offering_uid.description: The underlying directory offering uid. Must be a valid offering_uid either from vcita or from the offering GET API.

purchase_currency.description: The purchase currency at the moment of the subscription was created. Supported currencies: USD; EUR; GBP

business_cart.description: Optional. The business cart identifier to associate with this subscription.

coupon_code.description: Optional. Discount identifier used for tracking and Recurly integration. This is the coupon code that will be applied to the subscription.

price.description: Optional. The actual amount charged to the customer. When provided, this overrides the standard offering price. **Important**: This parameter is restricted to directory/admin tokens only. Staff tokens cannot set custom prices.

purchase_state.description: The requested purchase state of the subscription. If expired is selected, the expiration_date is ignored and current date will be used. If canceled is selected, the expiration_date must be provided. Note that is_active is dymanically calculated based on status and expiration_date

expiration_date.description: The date to expire the subscription. Should be in ISO8601 format (e.g., 2023-10-01T00:00:00Z) and at least one day in the future. Use 'expired' purchase_state if you want to immediately expire the subscription.

StaffMemberUpdate.description: Request body for updating a staff member's profile information.

first_name.description: The first name of the staff member.

last_name.description: The last name of the staff member.

display_name.description: The display name of the staff member used for public facing interfaces.

email.description: The email address of the staff member.

professional_title.description: The professional title of the staff member (e.g., "Senior Consultant", "Medical Director").

country_name.description: The country name for the staff member's mobile number (e.g., "United States", "United Kingdom").

mobile_number.description: The mobile number of the staff member without country code (e.g., "2345678901").

photo_url.description: The URL to the staff member's profile photo.

default_homepage.description: Default homepage when the staff member logs in. When null, the system default is used.

email_signature.description: The email signature of the staff member.

success.description: Whether the API request was successful

supported_languages.description: List of ISO 639-1 language/locale codes supported by the business for client-facing content (e.g., ["en", "es", "en-GB"]).

privacy_policy_url.description: External URL to the business's privacy policy page (e.g., "https://example.com/privacy"). Optional.

supported_languages.description: List of ISO 639-1 language/locale codes supported by the business for client-facing content (e.g., ["en", "es", "en-GB"]).

privacy_policy_url.description: External URL to the business's privacy policy page. Set to empty string or null to clear. Omit to leave unchanged.

field.description: The field that caused the error (for validation errors)

staff_quick_action_lists.description: List of staff quick action lists
